Route: City line near Patapsco Avenue north to MD 295 (continues south to Annapolis as Baltimore Annapolis Boulevard)
Landmarks: RESCO waste incinerator Patapsco Flea Market and Arena

Route: Harford Road north to Limit Avenue at city line (continues south as St. Lo Drive; continues north as Sherwood Road)
Notes: Planned as a road through a park when constructed. Carries MD 542 from south end to Loch Raven Boulevard.

Route: Boston Street west to dead end at Inner Harbor
Communities: Inner Harbor East, Fells Point, Canton
Notes: Site of house where Frederick Douglass once lived as slave (not known by that name then). Furniture store that was seed to Hecht's department store first opened on this street in the 1850s.

Route: Old York Road east to Harford Road (continues west as E. 39th Street; continues east as Parkside Drive)
Landmarks: Morgan State University House of Ruth Northwood Shop. Ctr. Herring Run Park

Route: Howard Street east to Charles Street
Notes: Street is one block long. Front of the Baltimore Museum of Art is located on this street.
